alert.note: Alert for Hot Springs; Washakie (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Tornado Warning issued May 26 at 5:01PM MDT until May 26 at 5:15PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM MDT FOR EAST CENTRAL HOT SPRINGS AND SOUTH CENTRAL WASHAKIE COUNTIES... At 501 PM MDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located 10 miles north of Cottonwood Pass, or 29 miles south of Ten Sleep, moving northeast at 20 mph. . HAZARD...Tornado and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. This tornadic thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of east central Hot Springs and south central Washakie Counties. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
